Use recycled paper and plant-based materials for decorations: Instead of using traditional paper and plastic decorations, consider using recycled paper and plant-based materials such as bamboo or reusable cloth. This will not only reduce waste but also add a unique and natural touch to your wedding.

Choose eco-friendly transportation: Instead of renting a limousine or a fancy car, consider using eco-friendly transportation options such as electric or hybrid vehicles or bicycles. This will not only reduce your carbon footprint but also add a fun and unique twist to your wedding.

Serve locally sourced and organic food: Instead of serving traditional wedding food, consider serving locally sourced and organic food. This will not only support local farmers but also provide your guests with healthy and delicious food.

Use biodegradable or compostable products: Instead of using single-use products such as plastic cups and utensils, consider using biodegradable or compostable products. This will not only reduce waste but also help the environment.

Plant a tree or donate to an environmental organization: Instead of giving traditional wedding gifts, consider planting a tree or donating to an environmental organization in honor of your wedding. This will not only celebrate your love but also contribute to a positive cause.
